## Private Member Functions

### foldValueComparisonIntoPredecessors() {#a408a295f02e0ad60d19a06a3500ef775}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool SimplifyCFGOpt::foldValueComparisonIntoPredecessors (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; TI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilder">IRBuilder</a>&lt;&gt; &amp; Builder)</>}>
The specified terminator is a value equality comparison instruction (either a switch or a branch on &quot;X == c&quot;).

See if any of the predecessors of the terminator block are value comparisons on the same value. If so, and if safe to do so, fold them together.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/simplifycfg-cpp/#l00271">271</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/simplifycfg-cpp">SimplifyCFG.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>BasicBlock &#42; SimplifyCFGOpt::getValueEqualityComparisonCases (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; TI, std::vector&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-simplifycfg-cpp-/valueequalitycomparisoncase">ValueEqualityComparisonCase</a> &gt; &amp; Cases)</>}>
Given a value comparison instruction, decode all of the &#39;cases&#39; that it represents and return the &#39;default&#39; block.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/simplifycfg-cpp/#l00263">263</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/simplifycfg-cpp">SimplifyCFG.cpp</a>.

### hoistCommonCodeFromSuccessors() {#aed0de60b3a4cdd9b770db1e899b09524}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool SimplifyCFGOpt::hoistCommonCodeFromSuccessors (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; TI, bool AllInstsEqOnly)</>}>
Hoist any common code in the successor blocks up into the block.

This function guarantees that BB dominates all successors. If AllInstsEqOnly is given, only perform hoisting in case all successors blocks contain matching instructions only. In that case, all instructions can be hoisted and the original branch will be replaced and selects for PHIs are added.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/simplifycfg-cpp/#l00289">289</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/simplifycfg-cpp">SimplifyCFG.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### simplifyBranchOnICmpChain() {#af9c19092a8bf9d1f7cd5258f069e3180}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool SimplifyCFGOpt::simplifyBranchOnICmpChain (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchinst">BranchInst</a> &#42; BI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilder">IRBuilder</a>&lt;&gt; &amp; Builder, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp; DL)</>}>
The specified branch is a conditional branch.

Check to see if it is branching on an or/and chain of icmp instructions, and fold it into a switch instruction if so.

### simplifyEqualityComparisonWithOnlyPredecessor() {#a730174c2c9278803729768377a5cf39e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool SimplifyCFGOpt::simplifyEqualityComparisonWithOnlyPredecessor (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; TI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; Pred, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilder">IRBuilder</a>&lt;&gt; &amp; Builder)</>}>
If TI is known to be a terminator instruction and its block is known to only have a single predecessor block, check to see if that predecessor is also a value comparison with the same value, and if that comparison determines the outcome of this comparison.

If so, simplify TI. This does a very limited form of jump threading.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/simplifycfg-cpp/#l00265">265</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/simplifycfg-cpp">SimplifyCFG.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### speculativelyExecuteBB() {#a4f753b7115baefcfe8ea86b4356dcd40}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool SimplifyCFGOpt::speculativelyExecuteBB (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchinst">BranchInst</a> &#42; BI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; ThenBB)</>}>
Speculate a conditional basic block flattening the CFG.

Note that this is a very risky transform currently. Speculating instructions like this is most often not desirable. Instead, there is an MI pass which can do it with full awareness of the resource constraints. However, some cases are &quot;obvious&quot; and we should do directly. An example of this is speculating a single, reasonably cheap instruction.

There is only one distinct advantage to flattening the CFG at the IR level: it makes very common but simplistic optimizations such as are common in instcombine and the DAG combiner more powerful by removing CFG edges and modeling their effects with easier to reason about SSA value graphs.

An illustration of this transform is turning this IR: 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">BB:</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">  %cmp = icmp ult %<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea9dd4e461268c8034f5c8564e155c67a6">x</a>, %<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea415290769594460e2e485922904f345d">y</a></span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">  br i1 %cmp, label %EndBB, label %ThenBB</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">ThenBB:</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">  %<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm-am/#a5d0557608eaebed12bc00812724ba2cda41a13f3ce88ed84e63003e32b18c1235">sub</a> = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm-am/#a5d0557608eaebed12bc00812724ba2cda41a13f3ce88ed84e63003e32b18c1235">sub</a> %<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea9dd4e461268c8034f5c8564e155c67a6">x</a>, %<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea415290769594460e2e485922904f345d">y</a></span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">  br label BB2</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">EndBB:</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">  %<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/numbers/#a9473b507816be4056a158a41cfb86807">phi</a> = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/numbers/#a9473b507816be4056a158a41cfb86807">phi</a> &#91; %<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm-am/#a5d0557608eaebed12bc00812724ba2cda41a13f3ce88ed84e63003e32b18c1235">sub</a>, %ThenBB &#93;, &#91; 0, %BB &#93;</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">  ...</span></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>


Into this IR: 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">BB:</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">  %cmp = icmp ult %<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea9dd4e461268c8034f5c8564e155c67a6">x</a>, %<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea415290769594460e2e485922904f345d">y</a></span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">  %<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm-am/#a5d0557608eaebed12bc00812724ba2cda41a13f3ce88ed84e63003e32b18c1235">sub</a> = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm-am/#a5d0557608eaebed12bc00812724ba2cda41a13f3ce88ed84e63003e32b18c1235">sub</a> %<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea9dd4e461268c8034f5c8564e155c67a6">x</a>, %<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea415290769594460e2e485922904f345d">y</a></span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">  %cond = select i1 %cmp, 0, %<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm-am/#a5d0557608eaebed12bc00812724ba2cda41a13f3ce88ed84e63003e32b18c1235">sub</a></span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">  ...</span></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>



<SectionUser title="Returns">
true if the conditional block is removed.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/simplifycfg-cpp/#l00293">293</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/simplifycfg-cpp">SimplifyCFG.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### tryToSimplifyUncondBranchWithICmpInIt() {#a7bbef685dff30645447a9a45b8580055}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool SimplifyCFGOpt::tryToSimplifyUncondBranchWithICmpInIt (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/icmpinst">ICmpInst</a> &#42; ICI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilder">IRBuilder</a>&lt;&gt; &amp; Builder)</>}>
This is called when we find an icmp instruction (a seteq/setne with a constant) as the only instruction in a block that ends with an uncond branch.

We are looking for a very specific pattern that occurs when &quot;A == 1 || A == 2 || A == 3&quot; gets simplified. In this case, we merge the first two &quot;or&#39;s of icmp&quot; into a switch, but then the default value goes to an uncond block with a seteq in it, we get something like:

switch i8 A, label DEFAULT &#91; i8 1, label end i8 2, label end &#93; DEFAULT: tmp = icmp eq i8 A, 92 br label end end: ... = phi i1 &#91; true, entry &#93;, &#91; tmp, DEFAULT &#93;, &#91; true, entry &#93;

We prefer to split the edge to &#39;end&#39; so that there is a true/false entry to the PHI, merging the third icmp into the switch.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/simplifycfg-cpp/#l00286">286</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/simplifycfg-cpp">SimplifyCFG.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### turnSwitchRangeIntoICmp() {#aada197ef7cac5ac6dcde4947ab7a9801}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool SimplifyCFGOpt::turnSwitchRangeIntoICmp (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/switchinst">SwitchInst</a> &#42; SI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilder">IRBuilder</a>&lt;&gt; &amp; Builder)</>}>
Turn a switch into an integer range comparison and branch.

Switches with more than 2 destinations are ignored. Switches with 1 destination are also ignored.
